page.title: 01South Kirkby/Elmsall Area
page.content: {South Kirkby,Moorthorpe,South Elmsall {and Frickley}were all mentioned in the Domesday Book.All were agricultural until 1900,when the{Barnsley coal seam was opened up,and Kirkby,Moorthorpe and Elmsall grew rapidly to accomodate the influx of miners.Many of the old terraced houses have given way to modern houses and private estates. Though set in the industrial{heart of {Yorkshire,}there is beautiful countryside and beautiful walks within minutes of the villages.Until the 1960's the main source of employment was the mines,but now the emphasis has changed and diversified to other occupations.Recently,by Govt. directive,the area has become an {Enterprise Zone,}helping to offset the unemployment situation.This survey has highlighted the lack of many cultural and leisure amenities.
